{{Other uses}} {{Infobox company | name = Zumba Fitness, LLC | logo = Zumba Fitness logo.png | caption = | foundation = {{Start date and age|1999|10}} | founder = Alberto "Beto" Perez | defunct = | location_city = | location_country = | location = | locations = 180 countries | area_served = | key_people = | industry = Fitness | products = | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = {{URL|www.zumba.com}} | footnotes = | intl = }}
'''Zumba''' is a dance form with aerobics [[physical fitness|fitness]] program created by [[Colombia]]n dancer and choreographer [[Beto Perez|Alberto "Beto" Perez]] during the 1990s.<ref name=usatoday>[http://yourlife.usatoday.com/fitness-food/exercise/story/2011-10-27/Zumba-brings-the-dance-party-into-the-health-club/50940786/1 Zumba brings the dance party into the health club], ''USA Today'', 10 October 2011</ref> Zumba is a trademark owned by '''Zumba Fitness, LLC'''. The Brazilian pop singer [[Claudia Leitte]] has become the international ambassador to Zumba Fitness.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.claudialeitte.com/noticias/claudia-leitte-se-une-ao-time-de-estrelas-internacionais-da-zumba/index.html|title=Claudia Leitte se une ao time de estrelas internacionais da Zumba Fitness - Notícias - Claudia Leitte|publisher=}}</ref>
[[File:Zumba.Kochi.jpg|thumb|Zumba dancing at Kochi, India]] Zumba involves [[dance]] and [[Aerobics|aerobic]] movements performed to energetic music. The choreography incorporates [[hip-hop]], [[soca music|soca]], [[samba]], [[Salsa (dance)|salsa]], [[Merengue music|merengue]] and [[Mambo (dance)|mambo]]. [[Squat (exercise)|Squats]] and [[Lunge (exercise)|lunges]] are also included.<ref name=brides>[http://www.brides.com/wedding-dresses-style/fitness-and-health/2011/09/wedding-fitness-trend-zumba-class Fitness Guinea Pig: Zumba], ''Brides Magazine''</ref> Zumba Fitness, the owner of the Zumba program, does not charge licensing fees to gyms or fitness centers.<ref name=washingtonpost>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/07/30/AR2008073001580.html Zumba Shakes the Monotony Out of Ordinary Aerobics Classes], ''The Washington Post'', 31 July 2008</ref> Approximately 15 million people take weekly Zumba classes in over 200,000 locations across 180 countries.<ref name=about />
==Origin== Zumba was founded in the mid-1990s by Perez in Cali, Colombia. In 2001, Perez partnered with [[Alberto Perlman]] and Alberto Aghion, and the trio released a series of fitness videos sold via infomercial.<ref name="Zumba history">{{cite web|url=http://zumba.tlw.hu/en/history-of-zumba.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425170938/http://zumba.tlw.hu/en/history-of-zumba.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=25 April 2016|title=History of ZUMBA|date=25 April 2016|publisher=|accessdate=8 January 2017}}</ref> [[Insight Venture Partners]] and the Raine Group made an investment in 2012.<ref>{{Cite news |title= Zumba Fitness Announces Strategic Partnership with Top Media and Technology Firms |date= March 7, 2012 |work= Press release |url= https://s3.amazonaws.com/zumba/www-zumba-com/en-us/press/pdf/ZumbaMinorityInvestmentDeal.pdf |accessdate= January 30, 2017 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title= Twitter Backer Insight Venture Partners Sees Great Potential in Former Street Performer Behind Zumba Exercise Craze |publisher= Reuters |date= June 25, 2012 |url= https://www.pehub.com/2012/06/twitter-backer-insight-venture-partners-sees-great-potential-former-street-performer-behind-zumba-exercise-craze/ |accessdate= January 30, 2017 }}</ref> The company expanded into class instruction and by 2015, according to Perlman, there were 14 million Zumba students in 186 countries.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Crumpton|first1=Mark|title=zumba fitness CEO Perlman on Buisiness Model,Growth|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/b/2e1a1a4f-61e2-4a20-89da-f687f8e7fdf8|accessdate= 25 October 2016|publisher=Bloomberg}}</ref>
The name "Zumba" has no particular meaning; it was made up as a brand name.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.zumba.com/en-US/trademark|title=Zumba Fitness Trademark Usage & Zumba Logo Guide|publisher=Zumba.com}}</ref> The original name was Rumbacize, a combination of [[Tumba (music)|tumba]] ("to party" in Spanish, and a musical style and dance name), and [[Jazzercize]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://lubbockonline.com/business/2012-02-19/zumba-move-fitness-world|title=Zumba on the move in the fitness world|last=|first=|date=2012-02-19|work=Lubbock Avalanche-Journal|access-date=2018-02-05|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Zumba: Beto Perez & Alberto Perlman |url=https://www.npr.org/2017/12/04/567747778/zumba-beto-perez-alberto-perlman |date=December 4, 2017 |work=[[How I Built This]] with Guy Raz |publisher=[[NPR]]|accessdate=July 26, 2018}}</ref>
== Classes == [[File:US Army 52862 Zumba adds Latin dance to fitness routine.jpg|thumb|250px|An instructor coaches a Zumba class in a fitness center]] Zumba classes are typically about an hour long and are taught by instructors licensed by Zumba Fitness, LLC.<ref name="ReferenceA">{{cite web |url=http://fitbie.msn.com/get-fit/why-you-should-give-zumba-craze|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111231062050/http://fitbie.msn.com:80/get-fit/why-you-should-give-zumba-craze|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2011-12-31|title=...}}</ref> In one Zumba class, a person can burn up to 600 calories, depending on the energy put forth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wanttoknowit.com/who-invented-zumba/|title=Who Invented Zumba|publisher=|accessdate=8 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180110235719/https://www.rodalewellness.com/fitness/why-you-should-give-in-to-the-zumba-craze|title=Why You Should Give In to the Zumba Craze |date=3 August 2011 }}.</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/dietandfitness/5050441/Get-fit-dancing-Dance-to-a-different-beat-with-Zumba.html |title=Get fit dancing: Dance to a different beat with Zumba |author=Jane Alexander |publisher=''Daily Telegraph'' |accessdate=2012-03-10 |date=2009-03-30}}</ref> The music comes from the following dance styles: [[cumbia]], [[salsa (dance)|salsa]], [[merengue (dance)|merengue]], [[mambo (dance)|mambo]], [[flamenco]], [[cha-cha-cha (music)|chachacha]], [[reggaeton]], [[soca music|soca]], [[samba]], [[hip hop music]], [[axé music]] and [[tango]].
There are nine types of classes, for different levels of age and exertion.<ref name=about>{{cite web |url=http://www.zumba.com/en-US/about/ |title=About Zumba Fitness |accessdate={{date|2012-03-10}}}}</ref> * Zumba Gold is a program designed for beginners and older people. * Zumba Step is a lower-body workout that incorporates Zumba routines and step aerobics with Latin dance rhythms. * Zumba Toning is for people who do their workouts with toning sticks. It targets the abs, thighs, arms, and other muscles throughout the body. This type of Zumba class provides participants with a cardio workout and strength training. * Aqua Zumba classes are held in a swimming pool. The instructor leads the class poolside while participants follow in shallow water. Moves have been specially adapted to combine the same dance movements used in a Zumba Fitness class with those used in aqua fitness classes. * Zumba in the Circuit combines dance with circuit training.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zumba Fitness|url=http://www.zumba.com/|accessdate=25 April 2012}}</ref> These classes usually last 30 minutes and feature strength exercises on various stations in timed intervals. * Zumba Kids<ref name="ReferenceA" /> and Zumba Kids Jr. classes are designed for children between the ages of 7 and 11.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.zumba.com/en-US/party/classes/class-kids|title=Zumba Kids Classes - Kid-friendly dance fitness routines - Zumba Fitness|website=www.zumba.com}}</ref> * Zumba Gold-Toning is a toning class for older participants with goals of improving muscle strength, posture, mobility, and coordination. * Zumba Sentao is a chair workout that focuses on using body weight to strengthen and tone the body.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zumba Fitness - About|url=http://www.zumba.com/|accessdate=18 February 2013}}</ref> * Strong by Zumba was launched in 2016. This specialty combines high intensity interval training with Synced Music Motivation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.strongbyzumba.com/|title=STRONG by Zumba™ - Let It Sync In|last=Zumba|website=Zumba|language=English|access-date=2017-02-10}}</ref>
Zumba instructors have the option to become ZIN™ Members (Zumba Instructor Network members) to receive bimonthly training DVDs to assist with the creation of music and choreography for their personal Zumba classes.
Because Zumba offers different options, proponents of the Zumba program claim that it is safe for all ages, meaning that anyone from age 0 to 100 can participate in this form of aerobic exercise.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.webmd.com/fitness-exercise/features/zumba-fun-is-secret-ingredient-of-latin-dance-workout|title=Zumba: Fun Is Secret Ingredient of Latin Dance Workout|author=Barbara Russi Sarnataro|publisher=''WebMD''|accessdate={{date|2012-05-07}}}}</ref> At least some of the classes are specifically aimed at elderly people, to help them build strength, improve motion and posture, and socialize.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.agingwellmag.com/news/ex_032811_02.shtml|title=Zumba Gold Program Attracts Elders|author=Lindsey Getz|publisher=''AgingWell''|accessdate={{date|2012-05-07}}}}</ref>
== Legal status == In August 2017, Zumba was banned in [[Iran]] for being un-[[Islam]]ic.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Erdbrink |first1=Thomas |title=Iran Bans Zumba, and Its Fans Fume |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/17/world/middleeast/iran-zumba-haram.html |website=The New York Times |accessdate=4 September 2018 |date=17 June 2017}}</ref>
== Events ==
=== ZINCON === The annual ZINcon takes place in the US, where Zumba instructors from all over the world are reunited and attend master classes, speciality training and a Zumba concert.{{Citation needed|date=October 2017}}<ref>Zumba.com. “Zumba Instructor Convention.” Zumba Instructor Convention, Zumba Fitness, convention.zumba.com/about. Accessed Nov 3.</ref>
=== Zumba Cruise === In January 2016, the first Zumba Cruise took place.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Travel/worlds-zumba-cruise-set-sail/story?id=31608749|title='World's First' Zumba Cruise to Set Sail|first=A. B. C.|last=News|date=8 June 2015|website=ABC News}}</ref>
===Zumba Academy=== In addition to the Annual Zumba Convention, Zumba also holds a number of shorter one-day Academies where instructors can meet and attend master classes and rhythm sessions. These events are held in cities globally.{{Citation needed|date=October 2017}}
== Products ==
In 2005, the Zumba Academy was launched to license instructors for teaching Zumba classes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://times-news.com/local/x316475424/-Exercise-in-disguise-Zumba-really-catching-on|title='Exercise in disguise,' Zumba really catching on|author=Elaine Blaisdell|publisher=''Cumberland Times-News''|date={{date|2011-01-24}}|accessdate={{date|2012-03-29}}}}</ref>
===DVDs and CDs=== Zumba sold [[DVD]]s via [[infomercial]]s in 2002.<ref name=independent>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/the-secret-to-fitness-craze-zumbas-success-2350675.html|title=The secret to fitness craze Zumba's success?|publisher=''The Independent''|date={{date|2011-09-07}}|accessdate={{date|2012-03-29}}}}</ref> More than 10 million DVDs have been sold.<ref name="independent.co.uk">{{cite news|last1=Philby|first1=Charlotte|title=Zumba: You get fit, they get rich|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/healthy-living/zumba-you-get-fit-they-get-rich-8106992.html|publisher=Independent.co.uk|date=8 September 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518084424/http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/healthy-living/zumba-you-get-fit-they-get-rich-8106992.html|archivedate=18 May 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
In July 2012, Zumba released the compilation album ''[[Zumba Fitness Dance Party]]''.
===Clothing=== In 2007 the company launched a clothing line called Zumba Wear.<ref>http://www.GreedyGirlsGuide.com, [http://www.greedygirlsguide.com/5-website-get-zumba-gear-best-prices "5 Websites to Get Zumba Gear"], ''Zumba Information'', 2013-25-11</ref><ref name=foxbusiness>{{cite web|url=http://smallbusiness.foxbusiness.com/entrepreneurs/2011/04/11/zumba-movement-catches-comes-hard/#ixzz1Z1F9ktjD|title=Zumba Movement Catches On, Now Comes the Hard Part|author=Cindy Vanegas|date={{date|2011-04-11}}|accessdate={{date|2012-03-29}}|publisher=''Fox Business''}}</ref> As of 2012, official apparel sales amounted to $10 million per year.<ref name="independent.co.uk"/>
===Video games=== In 2010 Zumba released its first [[Zumba Fitness (video game)|fitness video game]] on November 30, 2010.<ref name=about /> {{As of|2011|8}}, it had sold 3 million copies.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/09/13/majescoentertainment-idUSL3E7KD3W920110913 |publisher= ''Reuters'' |title=UPDATE 2-Zumba Fitness, new game launches boost Majesco outlook|author=Soham Chatterjee|date={{date|2011-09-13}}|accessdate={{date|2012-04-05}}}}</ref>
The ''[[Zumba Fitness 2]]'' video game was released in November 2011. A similar game was released on the Xbox 360 as ''Zumba Fitness Rush'' in February 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamestop.com/xbox-360/games/zumba-fitness-rush/97903|title=Zumba Fitness Rush by Majesco|publisher=''GameStop''|accessdate={{date|2013-02-18}}}}</ref>
''[[Zumba Fitness Core]]'' was released in October 2012 for the Wii and Xbox 360. The game includes new features such as nutrition tips and ability to set personal goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamestop.com/wii/games/zumba-fitness-core/102478|title=Zumba Fitness Core by Majesco|publisher=''GameStop''|accessdate={{date|2013-02-18}}}}</ref>
''[[Zumba Fitness: World Party]]'' was released on November 5, 2013. It features a new World Tour mode that unlocks songs from seven global destinations as a player progresses, as well as authentic customs, local rhythms and native dance styles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zumbafitnessgame.com/zumba_worldparty.php|title=Zumba Fitness World Party by Majesco|publisher=''Majesco Entertainment Company''|accessdate={{date|2014-01-02}}}}</ref>
The game was followed by ''[[Zumba Kids]]'' on November 19, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zumbafitnessgame.com/zumba_kids.php|title=Zumba Kids by Majesco|publisher=''Majesco Entertainment Company''|accessdate={{date|2014-01-02}}}}</ref>
All of the [[Zoë Mode]]-developed Zumba titles run on [[Epic Games]]' [[Unreal Engine 3]].
====Games==== * ''[[Zumba Fitness (video game)|Zumba Fitness]]'' (2010) * ''[[Zumba Fitness 2]]'' / ''Zumba Fitness Rush'' (2011)/(2012) * ''[[Zumba Fitness Core]]'' (2012) * ''[[Zumba Fitness: World Party]]'' (2013) * ''[[Zumba Kids]]'' (2013)
